name: superorganic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to the parts of a culture that are believed to be more important than the individual members of the society: Culture is superorganic in the sense that it is acquired by learning. This argument treats culture as a discourse and not as a super-organic entity.
More examplesFewer examplesShe believed in the superorganic theory that culture is distinct from biology .His opposition to the idea of culture as superorganic was not related to his study of psychology.A superorganic interpretation of culture requires unique methods.
